title: Doctors Pulled a 6-Foot Tapeworm Out Of This Guy’s Mouth
text:
Your Privacy Rights Canadian Customers 
Of all the things you’d be horrified to learn were living inside your body, the Chestburster from Alien is probably number one. Actually, yes, that’s definitely number one. But a 6-foot tapeworm isn’t too far behind. In 2014, doctors pulled one of those suckers out of a 48-year-old Indian man, and wrote about their horrific discovery —complete with pictures and video!—in the latest issue of the New England Journal Of Medicine . (That’s the tapeworm above.) 
The man had been complaining of some pretty bad abdominal pain that lingered for 2 months, so docs performed a colonoscopy to discover the source. That’s about the time they found “an undulating, moving piece of the worm ,” Dr. Cyriac Phillips told CNN , and uncovered the rest of the creature during a follow-up endoscopy, a procedure that doctors use to look at your intestines. So they sedated the man and extracted the worm by pulling it out through his mouth with a pair of forceps, because what else are you going to use to dig up a 6-foot tapeworm? Your bare hands? “We pulled at it softly and steadily, and ultimately the job was done after maybe around 1 hour and 15 minutes,” Phillips said. “I have never seen a tapeworm this long before this particular case.” Advertisement
